articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Shares of U.S. Steel (X.N) jumped 29% in premarket trading on Monday, after the more-than-a-century old steelmaker rejected a $7.3 bln buyout offer from Cleveland-Cliffs and said it would review its options following "multiple unsolicited proposals".
articles.title: U.S. Steel shares jump after unsolicited bid from Cleveland-Cliffs

articles.author: Dawn Chmielewski
articles.description: Hollywood's favorite parlor game of the week: What will Bob Iger do next?
articles.title: Disney's future, a hot topic among Hollywood elite

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: Sam Bankman-Fried will prepare for his fraud trial from a Brooklyn jail where inmates ranging from convicted sex trafficker Ghislaine Maxwell to Honduras' former president have complained of subpar conditions.
articles.title: Bankman-Fried heads to Brooklyn jail notorious for poor conditions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tesla (TSLA.O) on Monday said it has cut prices in China for its Model Y long-range and performance versions starting on Aug. 14, sending its shares lower on concern of further pressure on its profit margins.
articles.title: Tesla cuts prices in China for some Model Y versions

articles.author: Clare Jim, Shuyan Wang
articles.description: Country Garden, China's largest private developer, is seeking to delay payment on a private onshore bond for the first time, a source said, after suspending trading in 11 onshore bonds, sending its shares plunging to a record low on Monday.
articles.title: China's Country Garden seeks to delay onshore bond repayment, fanning market fears

articles.author: Howard Schneider
articles.description: Pessimists watching the Federal Reserve battle inflation have focused on the so-called "last-mile" problem, convinced a full return to the U.S. central bank's 2% inflation target will require a recession and significant job losses to cool ongoing price rises.
articles.title: A smooth 'last mile' to 2% inflation may not be a stretch for Fed

articles.author: Michael Erman
articles.description: A new COVID vaccine is due out next month, but health experts and analysts say it is likely to be coolly received even as hospitalizations from "Eris", a variant of the Omicron form of the coronavirus, rise around the country.
articles.title: New Covid vaccines are on the way as 'Eris' variant rises

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin's economic adviser rebuked the central bank on Monday as the rouble slid past 101 per U.S. dollar, blaming its 30% year-to-date slump on loose monetary policy and revealing growing discord among Russia's monetary authorities.
articles.title: Kremlin blames loose monetary policy as rouble slides past 101 vs dollar

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Two Russians accused of disseminating propaganda on behalf of the Wagner mercenary group in two Polish cities have been arrested and charged with espionage, Interior Minister Mariusz Kaminski said on Monday.
articles.title: Poland detains two Russians for distributing Wagner Group propaganda
